title: Crossing Quicksand and Bog Safely
brief: Technique for safely traversing quicksand, bogs, and similar unstable terrain.
steps: Step 1: Test questionable sandy areas by tossing a small stone - it will sink in quicksand.
Step 2: Lie face down with arms and legs spread wide to distribute weight.
Step 3: Use flotation device or create air pockets in clothing for additional buoyancy.
Step 4: Swim or pull your way across using slow, deliberate movements.
Step 5: Keep body horizontal and avoid trying to lift feet while standing upright.
Step 6: Move slowly and maintain calm - do not thrash about.
warnings: Never try to walk upright across quicksand or bogs - this will make you sink deeper.
Do not panic or make rapid movements - this increases sinking risk.
Quicksand commonly occurs on flat shores, silt-choked rivers, and near large river mouths.
Attempting to lift feet while upright will cause you to sink deeper quickly.
